SENT.plain: We report a patient with Budd-Chiari syndrome (BCS) and extrahepatic portal obstruction (EHO) associated with congenital antithrombin (AT) III deficiency
A 35-year-old man was admitted to Nishi Kobe Medical Center for evaluation of abnormal intrahepatic veins
By various imaging modalities, BCS and EHO were diagnosed
Laboratory data revealed parallel decreases in activity and antigen concentration of AT III despite normal liver function
Taken together, the etiology of both BCS and EHO was considered to be thrombosis, associated with congenital AT III deficiency
Two years after beginning warfarin therapy, the patient has no symptoms and his liver function remains normal
Anticoagulant therapy is considered useful for preventing progression of the disease
